gurmukhi: ਹਰਦੀ ਅੳੁ ਚੂਨਾ ਮਿਲਿ ਅਰੁਨ ਬਰਨ ਜੈਸੇ ਚਤੁਰ ਬਰਨ ਕੈ ਤੰਬੋਲ ਰਸ ਰੂਪ ਹੈ
transliteration: Haradee Au Choonaa Mili Aroun Baran Jaisay , Chatur Baran Kai Tanbol Ras Roop Hai ?
translation: As turmeric and lime when mixed produce red colour, but when betel leaf, lime, betelnut and catechu are all brought together, a very deep red colour is produced;

gurmukhi: ਦੂਧ ਮੈ ਜਾਵਨੁ ਮਿਲੈ ਦਧਿ ਕੈ ਬਖਾਨੀਅਤ ਖਾਂਡ ਘ੍ਰਿਤ ਚੂਨ ਮਿਲਿ ਬਿੰਜਨ ਅਨੂਪ ਹੈ
transliteration: Doodh Mai Jaavanu Milai Dadhi Kai Bakhaaneeata , Khaand Ghrit Choon Mili Binjan Anoop Hai ?
translation: As a small cogulent added to the milk set it as curd but sugar, flour and clarified butter produces a very tasty dish;

gurmukhi: ਕੁਸਮ ਸੁਗੰਧ ਮਿਲਿ ਤਿਲ ਸੈ ਫੁਲੇਲ ਹੋਤ ਸਕਲ ਸੁਗੰਧ ਮਿਲਿ ਅਰਗਜਾ ਧੂਪ ਹੈ
transliteration: Kousam Sougandh Mili Til Sai Dhulayl Hota , Sakal Sougandh Mili Aragajaa Dhoop Hai ?
translation: An extract of flowers when mixed with sesame oil become scented oil, but mixing of saffron musk, sandalwood and rose make a very fragrant product called argaja;

gurmukhi: ਦੋੲਿ ਸਿਖ ਸਾਧਸੰਗੁ ਪੰਚ ਪਰਮੇਸਰ ਹੈ ਦਸ ਬੀਸ ਤੀਸ ਮਿਲੇ ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ੳੂਪ ਹੈ ||੧੨੨||
transliteration: Doi Sikh Saadhasangu Panch Paramaysar Hai , Das Bees Tees Milay Abigati Oop Hai ?122?
translation: So would two Sikhs together make a holy congregation while five of them would represent the Lord. But where ten, twenty or thirty like-minded Sikhs engrossed in the love of the Guru meet, their praise is beyond description. (122)
